DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for breast carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain Breast Neoplasm Pathologic M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. wz

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to invasive (infiltrating) carcinoma of the breast and ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast. It does not apply to breast sarcoma, phyllodes tumor, and breast lymphoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven metastases larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven metastases larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven metastases larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven metastases larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer without clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases. Imaging studies are not required to assign the cM0 category. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer without clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases. Imaging studies are not required to assign the cM0 category. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases in the presence of tumor cells or deposits no larger than 0.2 mm detected microscopically or by molecular techniques in circulating blood, bone marrow, or other nonregional nodal tissue in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases in the presence of tumor cells or deposits no larger than 0.2 mm detected microscopically or by molecular techniques in circulating blood, bone marrow, or other nonregional nodal tissue in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
